title: Kuma Intentionally Sent Each Straw Hat to Perfect Training Locations
summary: A theory that Bartholomew Kuma didn't randomly scatter the Straw Hats, but specifically chose each location based on knowledge from his travels and possibly orders from Dragon, sending each crew member to a place that would maximize their growth during the separation period.
fullText: Fans theorized that Kuma's separation of the Straw Hats was not random, but a calculated decision. Each crew member was sent to a location perfectly suited to their development. Nami went to Weatheria to learn advanced weather science, Franky to Karakuri Island to discover Vegapunk's technology, Robin to Tequila Wolf where she'd be rescued by the Revolutionary Army, and so on. The theory suggested Kuma had visited these locations during his search for a cure for Bonney's disease and knew they would be ideal training grounds. This was later confirmed in manga chapters 1099 and 1102, which revealed Kuma had indeed visited these islands and chose them intentionally to help the Straw Hats become stronger before entering the New World.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: Kuma's Choices, Dragon's Plans, and Vegapunk and the R.A. Part 3

title: Weather Balls Will Enable Nami to Fly Like a Witch
summary: A theory that Nami will eventually use Weather Ball technology and her Clima-Tact to achieve flight, similar to how witches fly on broomsticks, which would be a significant power-up for her given her physical limitations.
fullText: Fans have theorized that Nami, having learned weather manipulation from Weatheria and incorporated Weather Balls into her Sorcery Clima-Tact, will eventually develop the ability to fly using her weapon similar to how witches in folklore ride broomsticks. This would address one of Nami's main weaknesses - her relatively weak physical body - by giving her aerial mobility and positioning advantages in combat. The theory is supported by Weatheria's wizard/witch aesthetic (scientists wearing pointed hats and robes) and the incredible power of Weather Balls that Haredas warned could 'cause chaos around the world' if weaponized. Flying would also thematically fit Nami's role as navigator, allowing her to get better vantage points for weather observation and navigation.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: Nami's Next Power Up (The Weather Witch) - One Piece Wiki

title: Vegapunk's Laboratory Technology Connects to Ancient Weapons
summary: A theory that some of the technology Franky discovered in Vegapunk's laboratory on Karakuri Island may have connections to the ancient weapons or ancient kingdom technology, explaining Vegapunk's genius.
fullText: Some fans theorize that Vegapunk's incredible technological prowess may stem from discovering and reverse-engineering ancient technology, possibly related to the Ancient Weapons or the lost civilization that created the Poneglyphs. When Franky discovers Vegapunk's laboratory on Karakuri Island in episode 453, it's filled with advanced blueprints and designs far beyond current technology levels. The theory suggests that Vegapunk's work on Karakuri Island may have involved studying remnants of ancient technology, which would explain how he achieved breakthroughs like artificial Devil Fruits and Pacifista cyborgs. This would also create an interesting parallel between Franky (who studied Pluton blueprints) and Vegapunk, both having access to world-changing ancient designs. The theory gains credence from Vegapunk's later revealed connections to the Void Century and ancient history.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: One Piece: What Vegapunk's Introduction Could Mean for Franky

title: Weatheria and Vegapunk Connection
summary: A theory that Weatheria's weather technology and Vegapunk's scientific work may be connected, possibly through shared research or Vegapunk having visited or collaborated with Weatheria scientists.
fullText: Recent manga developments have teased a potential connection between Nami's timeskip mentor Haredas from Weatheria and Dr. Vegapunk. Given that both represent the pinnacle of scientific achievement in the One Piece world - Weatheria for meteorology and Vegapunk for general science and technology - fans theorize they may have collaborated or shared research at some point. This theory gained traction when manga chapter 1125 appeared to tease connections between the two. If confirmed, this could mean that Nami's weather manipulation abilities may be enhanced with Vegapunk-level technology in the future, creating an interesting parallel with Franky who directly used Vegapunk's designs. The theory also suggests that Kuma sending Nami specifically to Weatheria may have been influenced by knowledge of this Weatheria-Vegapunk connection.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: One Piece teases the connection between Nami's timeskip mentor and Vegapunk in chapter 1125
